utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Hello~ Hello, good aftern~ hello, good afternoon.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm planning to go to Singapore next month and I'm kinda wondering what to- what's in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh how many days are you intending to spend in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm planning to stay for three days or two days.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I think three days may be a bit better.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Two days is just one night, you know?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh do you have any dates or is it still open?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um, I'm planning to go there next month on April seventh because I'm gonna have a long weekend.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, it's because it~ Yes, because it's our Country's holiday.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh I'm planning to travel with my friend.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And I presume you are in your twenthies you sound young.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, I am twenty five and I lo~

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm planning to travel with just a backpack.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Can you give me some %uh- tell me some cheap rate hotels because I'm planning just to leave my bags there and go somewhere take some pictures.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %uh for sure I'll bring my camera and other stuff.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But %uh, may %uh- I - I like taking pictures.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You would- do you have a particular subject?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Is it people or you also take sceenery and animals?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah %uh I can also take those pictures.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But I like cultu~ %uh nature more.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I'm going to recommend- firstly you want to have a backpack type of hotel, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm just gonna bring my backpack and my buddy with me.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I'm kinda looking for a hotel that is not that expensive.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Just gonna leave our things there and, you know, stay out the whole day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you don't mind if it's a bit %uh not so roomy like hotel because you just back to sleep.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: As we just gonna put our things there and then go out to take some pictures.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Is the InnCrowd Backpackers Hostel in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But %uh you are looking for a room, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You are not looking for a bed?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, we do have backpackers joints were you get %uh only a bed if you like include six to eight people in a room.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because %uh I'm just thinking of a place where I can you know, leave my bags, my stuff, you know.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And when I come back I just sleep for just a few hours and then go out at night with my friend.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you save a lot of money, huh?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I was- I'm planning to save lots of money or much money just to spend there for like a souvenir or taste Singaporean food like that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You'll have a heaven here for eating.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can eat a lot of food, a lot of %um-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh I eat different kinds of foods.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so you could eat street food?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I'm thinking of a place where I can %uh just walk and then %um get some street food or- yah I'm planning to be immersed in Singapore but to stay in hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, this is very colourful for you two guys.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh can you see the rates on your screen?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you take a dorm bed per person only twenty dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you take a room, it's two single beds at fifty nine dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And that would be fifty nine for two beds.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, the prices are based on per person per bed or dorm.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it should be fifty nine for the two room.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you're actually paying about ten dollars more per person only.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That's- the price is reasonable actually.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is it near at train station or something like a public transportation station?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Little India has got two tran stations- two stops.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They are actually quite close to each other.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's Little India stop and the Farrer Park stop.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And your hotel would be in that vicinity.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you see you get here, you get breakfast, dinner.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That means you get your towel, you got a locker and internet access.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And that's for a fifty nine Singaporean dollar?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you take a bit more luxurious a double room, a double bed and a single bed.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That means one of you sleeps in a bigger bed.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That would be for three people I think.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %uh is it near the airport?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no. But you can get there easily by taking the trains %uh from the airport.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You just need to make a change in the train direction.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you went for example all the way to Chinatown so you will have to cha~ take a change of trains.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because I have no idea at all about Singapore trains or transit.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh how can I go to the train or to the transit from the airport?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is it just outside the airport?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's actually at the basement the airport.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And that is the first thing you should do when you arrive.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh change some local money and then %uh you take the train.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: you buy the card and %ah you pay a deposit.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You put money into the card then after that you don't have to worry about having enough change to %uh pay the fare.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh, %uh so it means that I can use that card any day?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, you can use the card %uh-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: As lo~ As lo~ Yes, as long as it has a credit, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: As long as you got money in it %uh you will get a card.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh %um waiting for it to download the map.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Then I can show you %uh the location of your hotel and in relation to where the airport is.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, if you look on the right-hand side of the sccren, can you see Changi Airport at the bottom right-hand where number three is?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So when you reach the airport you go down to the basement.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh this would be the airport terminals conduc~ connecting terminals one, two, and three.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you are at a budget hotel- %uh budget airport, you have to take a shuttle to the main airport and then go to the bus stat~ to the %um train station and-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh is it far from the airport or I tak~ or I can just walk to the a~

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No, it's between the airport but it's easier to just take the shuttle.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a free shuttle that runs bet~

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you get your ticket, you pay your deposit.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And I think at the airport they gave you a map.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: and- to give you an idea.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you travel along the East line towards the West.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see Tanah Merah on the second stop?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that is where you change to go down to town to the West towards the West.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you go down to- just give me a minute.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: To %uh, I think the easiest way is to go to Outram Park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see where it goes all the way down and it curves up a little bit?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: O U R T- O U T R-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So when you get up there, you take the line towards Little India.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's one, two, three stops and you are at Little India.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is the place that you can go out and try street food you can soak in the atmosphere.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You would love taking your camera out because you can photograph the Indian garland makers, the fortune tellers.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's full of life and culture.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's one of my favourite places.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is Little India is like a Indian community town or Indiantown?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there are Hindu temples there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can photograph beautiful architecture and statues of the different Deities, the Hindu Deities.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So other than Indiantowns, are there other %uh nations town there or race town?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, Little India if you are visiting the temples, you avoid from about twelve noon to four o'clock, they have a break.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you go early morning or you go in the evening.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then Chinatown you take the same line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you'll get off at Chinatown, you are right in the heart of Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And in Chinatown we have %uh also Bhuddist temple and Terrace temple also great for photography.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we have Little India, then Chinatown Other than that two, there are other kinds of town, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Like %uh- is there a %um something like Vietnamese town or just the two of these?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Not Vietnamese but there is %uh Kampong Glam which you have to go by bus because- well actually you could go by train because you are young and healthy you can walk.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You go to %um, City Hall Station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So let's say you are at Little India, you gotta run to Dhoby Ghaut.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, just one stop %uh towards the South.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you take the red line which is called the Circle line and you get just one stop at City Hall Station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: and when you get off, ask the direction to Beach Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So not only do you walk towards the Malay quarter or rather the historic %uh, quarter for the Malays the Malays have mainly moved out from there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But there's a beautiful mosque there and on the way you will pass Raffles Hotel which is a historic hotel and also a consolation buidling.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh what other activities can we do with my friend during the night?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh do you like barhopping %uh or just- you still want to walk around, stroll around and take in the sights.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh maybe after barhopping may be we can just stroll around.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh wait, I have a question.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is it safe there to walk- just walk around at night?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um, you don't just flash go chains around your neck, you'll be okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is there a like curfew in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We haven't heard of one for a long time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um most Singaporean's will not know what you mean when you say curfew.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So it wouldn't matter if we just stroll around at three o'clock in the morning, something like that?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you take your train like Little India you would take the train to Dhoby Ghaut, you take the Circle line down, and you go down to Marina Bay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's a very scenic area by the river and you could walk around there and you- if you want the bus, you go down to Clarke Quay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And we- it's not shown on the map but we have a river there and you could go barhopping, you could eat, you could pick-up some girls.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But you meet a lot of people there that you know, they will might just talk to you if they are tourists.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, I- Yah, I like making friends specially with other- yah other people or in strange place %uh like Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, because %um I have a friend who just go to other countries %uh just having his backpack and then just leave his things in a room or in a hotel and roam around take pictures.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm gonna thinking to do the same thing.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh another place say, okay, the next day i~ or if you want to go to attractions to take photos %ah of animals, you- I suggest you go through the %uh Wildlife Safari's Park %uh which you can also reach by train and by bus.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: On that weekend, will there be an occasion, special occasion that's going to happen in Singapore where I can go and take some pictures?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh it's more- It's also Easter for the Catholics and the Christians in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you might want to go to midnight mass.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh, I don't know whether the priest will be happy if you are using your flash taking photos.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But %uh in the day the churches are very beautiful to photograph.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They are not decorated but %uh, you will be able to photograph them.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What about in %uh outside the city?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: There is some place to go out from the city where I can take pictures?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, so %uh there are two places I want to suggest to you one is the natural wildlife area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's called Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve and there you can capture birds and crabs %Uh, monitor lizards, crabs climbing trees

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So once I bought a friend and he caughts a- got a photograph of a monitor lizard eating a fish.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh so they are all wild animals?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, they are all wild and they are protected there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So for bird photography is very good.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh and if you are really into bird photography it's from about September to April.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Actually if you come now right away you can still catch some brids, %uh that are coming from Mongolia.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So, you know, they are migratory birds.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is it far from my hotel?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How long would it take to go there from my hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, from your hotel- I don't have the map now but you connect with the %uh Northbound line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Sorry, the Westbound line and you go all the way to Kranji and then you take a bus.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you see the Kranji express here?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You pay three dollars as an adult and you get a ticket which you can use for your return journey.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So approximately how long would it take to travel?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because I don't want to spend day on travelling or %uh riding bus or riding trains.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: From you hotel to here may be about 50 minutes or so f you plan it correctly.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you look at the train timing.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you see the first line, Kranji?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's when the bus arrives to pick-up people.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you miss the nine o'clock, the next one is ten-fifteen.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But the alternative is if you miss this you take the public bus and then you have to walk about half a kilometre from where the bus stops to the reserve.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you take this bus, it drops you right outside.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Does it have an entrance fee?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh, entrance free at the moment is free.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Some day as they charge one dollar.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I might be wrong on that it's no more than one dollar anyway which is nothing, you know?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's %uh not even one U.S. it's one Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you see the rest of stops on the Kranji express.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh they've got a dairy farm where they have goats producing goats milk.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you catch the bus on it's whole journey, you get to visit the other farms.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But I think Sungei Buloh itself is enough to interest you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So if I go there and arrive %uh let say %uh in the evening and then maybe take some rest and then in the morning what do you suggest to go first?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You need to come here in the morning because they close about six o'clock, seven o'clock.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It will be too late to see anything.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that's the first place that I should go to- first thing in the morning?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %um you could time yourself so that when you come out of here, you could go to the bird park so that if no birds waive at you at this park, you go to the bird park and they all be smiling at you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So bird park, I like bird park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me try and get it for you here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Jurong is the place it is at and it's also well not too far from here, so it's convenient to go.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: B I R D P A R K, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I'm getting some noise at your sector.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh it's ou~ Yes, I can hear it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It sounds like an airplan flying by..

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It sounds like an airplan flying by..

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so here we have got bird shows, you'll be very good at taking photographs here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh this aviary, can you see it on your screen?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, the birds are flying free, African-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, well test your skill as a photographer.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And we also have a show, %uh two shows in fact.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh during showtime they offer you to hold a falcon, and you can photograph your friend and he can photograph you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: other than birds, what other animals can we take a picture?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is the bird park But, okay, I'm going to see %uh ticketing, alright?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because i'm suggesting that you buy a package ticket so that you can get, okay- so you see it's open from eighty-thirty 'till six.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The one that's %uh a bit darker in colour.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's called a Park Hopper Special.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: For adults it's fifty eight Singaporean dollar.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Which I suggest on the same day so that you can just walk from the zoo, and the Night Safari is next door.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then the bird park you go %uh on the day you go Sungei Buloh because you can take the train connection from Kranji, you would just go Southwards and you are at Jurong, and you just take a bus and you are there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So what about other than street food, of course I have to eat my dinner.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Wha~ where do you suggest me to eat my dinner?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The day that you are going to the Night Safari and zoo, I suggest you eat at the Night Safari or zoo.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh they have something cute called the Bongo Burger.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No. The Bongo is one of the names of the animals there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I heard it's a special Singaporean food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They just used the name of the animal.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um, at the bird park too, they have a restaurant.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that would make it much easier.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, because I also want to experience Singaporean delicacies or Singaporean dishes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh Sing~ do you like hot food?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the curries that you get in the place where, you know, in Little India they are authentic Indian taste.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But if you tell them that you don't want so much chili or, you know, to tell you which one is very hot, then they can tell you and you can avoid ordering those %uh dishes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but West Coast Road we have restaurants that serve North and South Indian restaurants.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Like they, you know, they offer Singaporean delicacies or Singaporean dishes?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do you have a Singaporean dishes in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh, Singaporean food is mostly try at the %uh food courts.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so it is not %uh, what do you call it?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But it's where you can actually see everybody cooking and %uh in fact ask the person what is he doing whether they were be very nice to- happy to accomodate you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you can- at the one place you can try Chinese, Malay and In~ %uh mostly Chinese food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: These's one I am recommending to you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me get it on the website.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it is at place called Maxwell Road which is in Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you take the train to Chinatown from where you are and you'd- It's near.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So here you have a picture of the food centre.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see the stalls on both sides?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So all this different coloured signs are different stalls.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And if you like, you- if you go at different times, you get different kinds of food or rather somes stalls if they are shut, they are operating later or earlier.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is it okay to take pictures on public- in public places?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's only at the places of %uh worship that you have to be a bit more careful.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Like in a Hindu temple or at a Bhuddist temple.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you know the people who are praying would not like to photographed.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But what about in government offices like- or government buildings %uh I don't know, may be some policemen might-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you don't take photographs inside the airport.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm, so ou~ but outside the airport, it's okay?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Outsie the airport if you are taking yourselves standing at the gate, I don't think anybody will make any noise.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's just when you are inside there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think all airports are about the same now.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh, thank you for touring me, What to do in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Will you guide me in Singapore personally?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: If ever I go there, you guide me personally?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You come to Saint Theresa's Church and look for me on the Saturday evening mass.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: A whole of Filipino's there and you're right at home.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So it won't be that hard to stay in Singa~ there lots of Filipinos there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, lots of good food, got lots of accomodation, different prices.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's very easy to visit on your own.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So don't wait too long to come by.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: You know, actually I'm really planning to travel to Singapore I just don't know when because, you know we have work.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I'll try to fit in a schedule.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, trying to fit in your schedule is not difficult, you know.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can tell it's %uh not expensive also.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And for people who read and speak English it's very easy because English is the working language used.
